You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Create a Product for Your Storefront

For a product sold by itself, setup is easy. Don't worry about composite products or component products—create just one product record with all the details.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Product records:	Create on CC Products
To create CC Product Media records:	Create on CC Product Media
To add a product to a price list	Create on CC Price List Items

The Product Detail page shows the product's SKU, price, short description, media, and other content.

To create a product for your storefront:

On the CC Products tab in your org, click New.
Specify the details that are required for the product to appear on your storefront.
For Product Name, enter the name that buyers see for the product on your storefront, such as Commercial Coffee Grinder.
For Storefront, select the storefront where the product is available.
For SKU, enter a unique stock unit ID for the product in your inventory system.
TIP
Avoid 15- or 18-digit alphanumeric values for a SKU. This format matches the standard Salesforce record ID format, which can result in unexpected behavior on the storefront.
The SKU field doesn't support the following special characters:
!	*	'	(	)	@	&
;	:	+	=	$	,	.
/	?	%	#	[	]	
Specify a Start Date and End Date range that includes the current date.
TIP If the product is available immediately, specify the current date for the Start Date value.
For Quantity per Unit, leave the default value of 1 unless the product is meant to be purchased in multiple quantities.
TIP To enforce specific quantities when adding the product to a cart, set up product quantity rules.
If you’re using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or later, optionally select Exclude from Product Index.
NOTE When you select this option, the product isn’t included in the product index build job. As a result, the product isn't shown in search results or category results on the Product List page. The product still has a Product Detail page, and you can link to the product from a promotion or a Related Products page section.
For Product Type, select Product.
For Product Status, select a value:
In Creation
The product isn't visible on the storefront because you're still fine-tuning its details or pricing.
Blocked
The product isn't visible on the storefront because you've chosen to hide it.
Not Orderable
The product is visible on the storefront but buyers can't add it to a cart or place an order.
Released
The product is visible on the storefront and buyers can add it to a cart and place an order.
NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, any value other than Released causes the Scaled Cart page to show the product as unavailable in the cart. For more information, see Unavailable Products on the Scaled Cart Page.
If your storefront calculates tax at checkout and the product is subject to sales tax, enable Taxable. For more information about taxes, see Calculate Tax at Checkout.
TIP For the product's availability message, instead specify an availability message on a CC Product Inventory Item related record.
Give your buyers more information about the product by adding short and long descriptions.
On the product record, scroll to the Description section.
For ShortDescRT, enter a short description (up to 2,000 characters) for the product.
NOTE The short description appears by default throughout your storefront, including:
On the Product Detail page
When the product is a result on the Product List page
When the product is shown in the Featured Products or Spotlight Products widget on the Home page
For LongDescRT, enter a longer description (up to 5,000 characters) for the product.
TIP By default, the managed package doesn't show the long description on your storefront. To include the long description on your Product Detail page, create a page section. In the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront data set, this page section is already set up.
NOTE The managed package no longer uses the non-RT fields for the short or long description.
To help drive external traffic to your storefront as part of your organization's SEO strategy, complete the fields in the SEO section.
In the Shipping Section, enter a weight (decimal value in pounds) for Shipping Weight.
NOTE A shipping weight is required for showing shipping options during checkout. To calculate shipping cost for an order that includes this product, set up shipping rates.
In the Shipping section, optionally complete the following fields, which you can show on the storefront by using a page section on the Product Detail page:
Shipping Weight
Product Weight
Air Flag
NOTE This field is available only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13).
Ground Flag
Hazardous Flag
Coolerpak Flag
Overnight Flag
NOTE The other remaining fields are available but, by default, don't control any functionality in the managed package.
Click Save on the new product record.
To add product images or related documentation, create related CC Product Media records.
To ensure that buyers can find the product from your storefront's category tree, assign the product to a category.
To make sure that the product is available for your buyers, add the product to at least one price list.
If your storefront supports multiple locales, create localized product records for each supported locale.
If you're done updating product records, refresh product index records by running the product index batch jobs.
WARNING If you have more product records to update, wait to refresh product index records. Depending on the size and complexity of your product data, the batch jobs that build product index records can take a long time to complete.
